SENT.plain: Barrett's esophagus (BE) is a consequence of chronic gastroesophageal reflux
Barrett's esophagus is a well-established risk factor for adenocarcinoma
There is no effective method available to prevent the malignant transformation of Barrett's esophagus
Endoscopy is therefore the only means of patients' screening and monitoring
Endoscopic surveillance is recommended to detect precancerous or cancerous lesions at an early stage, where curative treatment can be proposed
